messages.message: You can either enter the name of a pre-defined material or element (clear form text and click arrow on right of form to see all predefined options), or you can enter a chemical formula such as 'H0.112 O0.88' where the numbers are the density in g/cm3, (or use mass fraction and Density field), of the preceding element.
This is the fraction of gammas that will make it through the specified shielding.
This is the distance from the source center to the detector.
Intrinsic efficiency (in-peak detection efficiency of gammas striking detector face).
Fractional solid angle of the selected detector at specified distance.
Intrinsic efficiency times solid angle fraction. E.g. the fraction of gammas making it out of the shielding that will be detected. Does not include attenuation.
Transmission fraction times detection efficiency. E.g. the fraction of gammas emitted from the source that will be detected.
